description: This is the entrance to one of the finest and oldest pubs in
Westbridge.  In this entrance way, many of the patrons' cloaks
and swords have been hung to ensure no violent fighting happens
within these ancient walls.  To the west is a door leading to the
Healing Wound Inn, a place of healing and sleep.  A small hallway
connects to the Westbridge Inn and rooms for sleeping to the east.
The Pub proper is north.
420.name: The Yawning Portal Inn

description: This large pub is one of the oldest drinking establishments in Westbridge.
Warriors, mages, druids, and all types of other people sit at tables talking
about their last adventure.  The working class men sit at the bar drinking
their cares and worries away in a nice cool cup of ale.  Justin the Bartender
is constantly looking for other people to serve.  The dining room lies north.
421.name: Inside The Pub

description: You stand in the large Lobby of the Opera House.  To the west a pair of
large oak doors hides the light from within the Opera House.  To the south
you see the hallway leading into the Town Hall.  The lobby is made from
white marble tiles, above you a huge skylight lets way of sunlight and the
stars.  The walls are covered with Pictures of diffrent actors and other
people who have been here.  The Opera House also serves as a communication
hall with the TriPower.
481.name: Lobby Of The Opera House

description: You enter the Announcer's Booth.  A large window to the south overlooks
the whole arena.  A large table stands infront of the window, along with a
large couch, this is where the announcer's of the WBA sit, and talk about
the fight, or other random things.  The walls here are covered in posters,
and diffrent papers.
413.name: Announcer's Booth

description: You stand in a bare room. Nothing in here but a table to sit on and a locker
to put stuff in. A small table and mirror sit against one wall. A large iron
door lays to the south.
435.name: Opponent 1 's Room

description: To the north, a large painting of the mayor stands, with a small plaque
under it.  You also see other paintings of past Mayors and Vise-Mayors.  You
see a painting of Mayor Grim, and Mayor Kaz.  To the south a large door
stands, two guards stand outside it.  On the door it says "Mayor's Office".
479.name: Hallway

description: This is a very cozy room.  A wide stone fireplace provides ample warmth.
A large soft bed sits near the fire, and a cushioned chair sits near the bed.
Books line the mantle, just waiting to be read.  Some pictures hang on the
wall.
460.name: Room 9

description: You are in the seating area of the Colliseum Of Pain.  Before you stands
the oldest and most popular arena in the whole Great Realms.  This Arena has
been around since the dawn of Westbridge, and many great fights have been
fought within its walls.  You have a great view of the arena itself from
here.  Above you, large glowing orbs float just below the ceiling.
411.name: Western Seating

description: This is the top of the inn stairs.  A long hallway leads all the way
north with numbered doors to each side.  The stairs lead down to the
lobby of the Westbridge Inn.
453.name: Upstairs Hallway Of The Inn

description: Standing among mud t-shirts and other crap people buy.  You see on the
walls t-shirts that say 'I Fought In The Coliseium Of Pain And Lived' and
mugs that say the same thing.  You also see one of those large foam fingers.
You see boots, hats, and all kinds of stuff pilled in here.  To the north
you see a bathroom.
432.name: Coliseum Of Pain Souvenir Shop

description: This is the upstairs hallway of the inn.  There are numbered doors
to the west and east.  Candle holders hang between the doors, gently
lightning the hallway.
{x
{G     <==<< {BRoom {R7 {*[{RThe Westbridge Inn{*] {BRoom {R8 {G>>==>{x
454.name: Upstairs Hallway Of The Inn

description: This is the middle of the upstairs hallway of the inn.  There are
numbered doors to the west and east.  Candle holders hang between the
doors, gently lightning the hallway.
{x
{G     <==<< {BRoom {R9 {*[{RThe Westbridge Inn{*] {BRoom {R10 {G>>==>{x
455.name: Upstairs Hallway Of The Inn

description: The hallway here turns to the north, and to the east.  To the south a
large door stands, with letter on it that read "Vice-Mayor's Office".  A
sign on the wall to the west reads "Reception Hall/Opera House".
480.name: Hallway

{B
| {WQuesting is a great way to earn some quest points for all   {b|
| {Wthose shiny items that Quija sells. Request a quest at any  {b|
| {Wshopkeeper you come across. Here are some helpful commands: {b|
| {GQUEST REQUEST    {g- {wwill request a quest from a shopkeeper.  {b|
| {GQUEST COMPLETE   {g- {wwill inform the shopkeeper that you have {b|
| {w                   finished the quest (and if so, you'll    {b|
| {w                   get a reward!)                           {b|
| {GQUEST INFO       {g- {wreminds you of your quest.               {b|
| {GQUEST TIME       {g- {wshows you how much time you have left in {b|
| {w                   your quest.                              {b|
| {GQUEST POINTS     {g- {wshows you how many quest points you have {b|
| {w                   earned so far (also seen in SCORE).      {b|
| {GQUEST BUY {g<{citem{g> - {wbuys a quest item from Quija.            {b|
| {YHELPFUL QUESTING TIPS:                                      {b|
| {WAll shopkeepers throughout Waterdeep will offer up the same {b|
| {Wkinds of quests, so use a shopkeeper that is easy to get to.{b|
| {WAlso, try to find one that stays open 24 hours to avoid the {b|
| {Whassle of having to wait for them to reopen to complete your{b|
| {Wquest.                                                      {b|
| {WWhen your quest involves killing someone or something, try  {b|
| {Wto keep your pets and mounts out of the fight. If they get  {b|
| {Wthe last killing blow in, the shopkeeper will not give you  {b|
| {Wcredit for your quest (they won't even recognize you when   {b|
| {Wyou return!).                                               {b|
| {WAll quest mobs and items can be accessed with gate spells,  {b|
| {Wif you happen to be a spellcaster.                          {b|
{x

{b|                                {RArea Quests                               {b|
{b| {cArea quests are quests specific to certain areas in the game.  Each      {b|
| {cquest is different, but most involve doing certain tasks in a certain    {b|
| {corder or solving puzzles to earn the quest points for that area quest.   {b|
| {cIn addition to quest points that can be redeemed for items here, many    {b|
| {carea quests also offer rare or unique items upon completion.  Each area  {b|
| {cquest can only be done once, but you can take as much time as you need   {b|
| {cto do each, and do them in any order you wish, or none at all.  More     {b|
| {carea quests are forthcoming.  To see a complete list of all area quests  {b|
| {ccurrently offered, type {CQUEST AREAQUEST {c(Note that some areas listed may {b|
| {cnot yet be open to the public).                                          {b|
| {cFor more information about a particular area quest, say the keyword      {b|
| {cshown in the list below.  Quija will respond with a brief description,   {b|
| {cand offer hints in where to get started on each.                         {b|
{b|                      {RArea Quests in the Great Realms                     {b|
{b| {CWestbridge{c: {wTo hear this quest, type {MSAY westbridge     {G(5 Quest Points) {b|
| {CNew Thalos{c: {wTo hear this quest, type {MSAY new thalos   {G(120 Quest Points) {b|
| {CDarrowmere{c: {wTo hear this quest, type {MSAY darrowmere   {G(125 Quest Points) {b|
|    {CHell   {c: {wTo hear this quest, type {MSAY hell quest   {G(130 Quest Points) {b|
| {CMakou City{c: {wTo hear this quest, type {MSAY makou city   {G(150 Quest Points) {b|
| {CTorregiano{c: {wTo hear this quest, type {MSAY torregiano   {G(200 Quest Points) {b|
{b| {CRuinsOfTru{c: {xTo hear this quest, type {MSAY ruins of tru {G(200 Quest Points) {b|{x
| {CCandlekeep{c: {wTo hear this quest, type {MSAY candlekeep   {G(250 Quest Points) {b|
| {CNew Ofcol {c: {wTo hear this quest, type {MSAY new ofcol    {G(300 Quest Points) {b|
{YNOTICE{c: {yThese triggers are case sensitive.  You must use all lower case for
Quija to respond to what you say (EXAMPLE:  to hear about the Westbridge
area quest, you must type SAY westbridge and not SAY Westbridge).{x
{x

This is a small smoke-filled room. There is a comfortable looking
chair here, a pew, and a quaint bed set near a large warming fire.
People sit around it, smoking their pipes and other various kinds
of paraphernalia from all across the realms. The one known as the
questmaster, Quija, sits here at the center of the room, in front
of a case filled with many beautiful items.  These are all of the
items that one can buy from Quija through the quest points earned
from the shopkeeper quests (see HELP QUEST).  You can examine any
of Quija's quest items here (type QUEST LIST for a list of items).
Above Quija there is also a sign which has information about AREA
QUESTS (type READ SIGN to read it).
471.name: The Questmaster's Room

description: Welcome to the Kitchen of the Yawning Portal Inn.  Here, a very fat
woman sits over a large cauldron of stew stirring away.  There are
large wooden counters that stretch all around the room.  Meat lies
on the counter being prepared for tonight's meal.
422.name: Kitchen

description: This is a very cozy room.  A wide stone fireplace provides ample warmth.
A large soft bed sits near the fire, and a cushioned chair sits near the bed.
Books line the mantle, just waiting to be read.  Some pictures hang on the
wall.
458.name: Room 11

description: Welcome to the Westbridge Inn.  This is a place where people can sit
and relax after a hard day of adventuring.  Here is a large lobby type
room with lots of pictures and paintings.  A table sits to one side of
the room, an elf dressed up is here waiting for customers.  There are
keys behind him with numbers on them.  Some stairs lead up.  The rooms
are to the north and upstairs.
{RRooms {G1{Y-{G6{x are north.
{RRooms {G7{Y-{G12{x are upstairs.
450.name: The Westbridge Inn

description: You step into the pizza parlor of Westbridge. You smell a pizza
being cooked in the oven. Small tables have been placed around
the room with little candles stuck in the bottles. You hear
music playing from some machine, kinda like a music box, but
louder.
401.name: Tony's Pizza Parlor

description: You stand on a large bridge, that extends between two mountains.  The
moon shines above, giving only the outlines of jagged, pointed mountains,
and the bridge.  Below you see many torches and spikes, sharp and evil.
409.name: Pit

description: You are standing in a large hall where the pkillers come and meet for the
rules, eq and other pkilling type of stuff.  The walls here look like
they're brick, but the kind of brick you find in a sewer.  You see some
benches and some tables here for people to sit down and think.  There are
two doors, one to the east and one to the west.  A Sign hangs on the
ceiling.
434.name: Meeting Hall

description: This corner of the arena is clean.  Wow!
445.name: SouthEast Arena

description: The room is bare and all you see are the boards of the walls.  This room
is still under construction.
492.name: Judge's Office

description: The hallway here leads towards the corner.  To the west a large door
stands, letters on the door read out "Town Board Meeting Room".  On the wall
to the east you see a large map of Westbridge, and a bigger painting of
Westbridge from the cliffs of Mount Olympic.  The hall continues to the
south.
477.name: Hallway

description: {%Welcome to the Westbridge 1st National Bank. We take all accounts.
{$"{%Withdraw{$" {5will let you take out money of your account.{5
{$"{%Deposit{$" {5will let you put money into your account.{5
{$"{%Balance{$" {5will let you see your money in your account.{5
{%Silver Cubic = 5x of a reqular cubic
{%Golden Cubic = 10x of a regular cubic
{%Platinum Cubic = 100x of a regular cubic{x
Welcome to the First National Bank Of The Tri-Power State.  To either
side of you the walls are lined with guards, armed to the teeth.  You see
many tellers behind a large wall, protected by iron bars.  The Bank that
once was powered by Westbridge itself, but now rules under the government.
Tables line the walls for people to write on.  The door is to the west.
{C|     {YWestbridge City Notice     {C|
{C| {RNOTICE: {MThe First National     {C|
{C| {MBank Of Westbridge will be     {C|
{C| {Mmoving to a location in the    {C|
{C| {Mtown of Westbridge, located at {C|
{C| {MMelancholy's Maps, and the map {C|
{C| {Mshop is being moved one north  {C|
{C| {Mof his present shop.           {C|
{C| {RThank You           {B<{RT{rriPower{B> {C|
498.name: 1st National Bank Of Westbridge

description: You see a light at the end of the tunnel.  You cannot see outside the
tunnel because your eyes try to adjust to the bright light introduced to
you.
406.name: Light!!

description: This is a room where you pump iron and practice your skills on the dummy.
The room is cluttered with medieval weight lifting machines and weapons.
You see some warriors in here pumping iron and getting ready for their next
adventure.  The only exit is east.
438.name: Training Room

description: Welcome to a room of fantasy.  All about are fringed pink and red
pillows.  A table sits in the middle with wine on it to help make dates
date a little more... interesting.  In the corner there is a large bed
(two guesses what it's for) with a few... pleasantries hanging beside it.
There is so much that can be done in this room that it's hard to decide
what to do first, or maybe just all of it...
415.name: Wine-Em, Dine-Em

description: You see the House Of Fetish
A large stage stands to the west, row after row of seats line the whole
hall.  The ceiling reaches up very high, where gas lights hang down from
above.  The whole hall is made from plaster, which has been carved out to
form a nice design, the seats are covered in a red cloth, and made from oak.
The stage to the west stands very high from the floor, large red curtains
hang on either side of the stage.
486.name: Opera House

description: Small sticks hold body parts on the wall here.  You see a some legs, some
arms, a torso, but no head.
447.name: Southwest Arena

description: Two feet of cold water sits at the bottom of the well.  The walls are
damp, covered in moss and mold.  There is nothing else of note within
this small, dank space.
427.name: Bottom Of The Well

description: A large pole hangs from the ceiling.  As you look up you see a rotting
corpes pinned to the wall.
443.name: South Arena

description: This is a very cozy room.  A wide stone fireplace provides ample warmth.
A large soft bed sits near the fire, and a cushioned chair sits near the bed.
Books line the mantle, just waiting to be read.  Some pictures hang on the
wall.
459.name: Room 12

description: You stand on a large bridge, that extends between two mountains.  The
moon shines above, giving only the outlines of jagged, pointed mountains,
and the bridge.  Below you see many torches and spikes, sharp and evil.
408.name: Pit

description: This is the end of the inn hallway.  A large window looks out onto
a lush lawn.  There are people walking in the lawn and kids playing.
There is a door to the west and a door to the east.
{x
{G     <==<< {BRoom {R5 {*[{RThe Westbridge Inn{*] {BRoom {R6 {G>>==>{x
457.name: End Of The Hallway in the Inn

description: This is the head office where the Leader Of Citizens Relations stands.  A
large desk stand in the middle of the room, behind the desk, a large bronze
shield of the TriPower stands.  A pair of chairs sit infront of the desk.
The walls are covered with books and drawers.  A window looks out into
Westbridge Park, near the road.  This office holds the person who rep.  The
TriPower, and will answer any questions you have.
495.name: Office Of Head Citizens Relations

description: This is a very cozy room.  A wide stone fireplace provides ample warmth.
A large soft bed sits near the fire, and a cushioned chair sits near the bed.
Books line the mantle, just waiting to be read.  Some pictures hang on the
wall.
468.name: Room 5

description: This small hallway connects the pub entrance of Yawning Portal Inn
and the Westbridge Inn lobby.  The walls here hold many pictures and
interesting newspaper clippings.  The pub lies through the west doorway
and the lobby to the east.
470.name: Entrance to the Westbridge Inn

description: You still move slowly through the tunnel.
405.name: River Tunnel

description: Dark, cold, empty.  No light shines in and no light shines out.  Nothing
to sit on, nothing to eat or drink.  The door is covered with sharp objects
and the walls filled with jagged sharp objects.  The only thing to do here
is stand and try not to cut yourself on the sharp objects.  You see the
floor is even covered in broken glass.
490.name: Jailcell

description: You are in the seating area of the Colliseum Of {RPain{7.  Before you
stands the oldest and most popular arena in the whole Great Realms.  This
Arena has been around since the dawn of Westbridge, and many great fights
have been fought within its walls.  You have a great view of the arena
itself from here.  Above you, large glowing orbs float just below the
ceiling.
412.name: Eastern Seating

description: You stand on the Westbridge Depot.  The trains are here, waiting to
leave, or dropping off its passangers.  To the west, you see a very large
building, which is the Train Station.  You are also standing outside the
wall of the City, which has been cut away and rebuilt.  The rails here go
north, south and east, The Train can go to Torregiano, New Thalos, or
Stonebow Dale from here.
402.name: The Westbridge Depot

description: This is a brightly light hallway.  Tables and lamps line the spaces
between each inn room door.  There are two doors here, one to the west,
and one to the east.
{x
{G     <==<< {BRoom {R1 {*[{RThe Westbridge Inn{*] {BRoom {R2 {G>>==>{x
451.name: Hallway in the Inn

description: The walls here are covered from a bloodbath.  The stones are stained {!red{x
with the blood of the innocent.
441.name: East Arena

description: This spot lies about midway down or up the well, depending on the direction
of travel.  It is very dark in here with little light filtering down.  Dripping
water echoes in the darkness.
426.name: Midway Down the Well

description: A large body sticks out of the wall.  You see brain fragments all over,
but the body still sits against the wall....
442.name: West Arena

description: The room is bare and all you see are the boards of the walls.  This room
is still under construction.
488.name: Mayor Kaz's Office

description: The bones of the dead lay around, weapons of destruction still on the
ground.  The smell of rotting flesh and fresh blood hits your nose.
440.name: Center Of The Arena

description: You stand in a dark hallway going to the arena.  To the west is a door
that reads 'Training Room' and a large iron door to the south that reads
'ARENA'.  There is a pair of stairs leading to the upper level of the
colliseum.  A sign next to the stairs points upwards, saying "SEATING".
437.name: Hallway To The Arena

description: You have fallen into the toilet.  You are underwater in a darkness.  The
only light you can see is the light from the toilet bowl above.  You see
weird and lost objects down here.  You see an old World War II mine and an
old couch.  The floor on the bottom seems to be made of stone.  You feel all
peace within yourself.
449.name: Inside The Toilet

description: Welcome to the TriPower's Citizens Relations Office.  This office holds
info on the TriPower, people to ask questions about the government, and
other info.  The room is filled with chairs, that line the walls.  A large
desk stands to the east, with workers behind it answering questions and
helping citizen's out.  To the south is a large door, leading to an office.
On the door large black letters spell out "Leader Of Citizen's Relations".
496.name: Citizen's Relations Office

description: This is a very cozy room.  A wide stone fireplace provides ample warmth.
A large soft bed sits near the fire, and a cushioned chair sits near the bed.
Books line the mantle, just waiting to be read.  Some pictures hang on the
wall.
469.name: Room 6

description: Here is a dimly lit dining area.  There are round tables everywhere
with a single candle in the middle.  The tables look big enough to seat
two people.  A stage has been set up to host musicians that travel to
play their sound for customers.  There is a small courtyard to the north
and the entrance to the kitchen is west.
423.name: Dining Room of the Inn

description: The room is bare and all you see are the boards of the walls.  This room
is still under construction.
489.name: Court Of Westbridge

description: This is a very cozy room.  A wide stone fireplace provides ample warmth.
A large soft bed sits near the fire, and a cushioned chair sits near the bed.
Books line the mantle, just waiting to be read.  Some pictures hang on the
wall.
463.name: Room 8

description: Heavy, rich mahogany furniture is placed about the bedroom.  Wind chimes
hang from the ceiling, ringing in a strange breeze that circulates
throughout the chamber.  Paintings of the sea adorning the wall pulse with
mysterious movement.  Oddly enough, the emanations of wind seem to originate
from them.  The room is bright with sunlight, creating an aura of calm.
400.name: {BBeltaine's Bedroom{0

description: This is a very cozy room.  A wide stone fireplace provides ample warmth.
A large soft bed sits near the fire, and a cushioned chair sits near the bed.
Books line the mantle, just waiting to be read.  Some pictures hang on the
wall.
461.name: Room 10

description: This is a very cozy room.  A wide stone fireplace provides ample warmth.
A large soft bed sits near the fire, and a cushioned chair sits near the bed.
Books line the mantle, just waiting to be read.  Some pictures hang on the
wall.
462.name: Room 7

description: If I'm here, say hello, if I'm not, don't let me catch you snooping around.
The room is bare and all you see are the boards of the walls.  This room
is still under construction.
497.name: Sheriff's Office

description: You stand in a bare room. Nothing in here but a table to sit on and a locker
to put stuff in. A small table and mirror sit against one wall. A large iron
door lays to the south.
436.name: Opponent 2 's Room

description: The Hallways of the City Hall of Westbridge.  To either side of you are a
big wooden door, leading into diffrent rooms.  The hall extends south aways,
and then turns to the west.  The walls are covered with diffrent pictures,
plaques and posters.  Above you large lights hang down, a blue flame comes
out of each of them.
476.name: Hallway

description: The room is bare and all you see are the boards of the walls.  This room
is still under construction.
491.name: Small Hallway

description: You are on stage, lights shine at your head, the opera house to the east
cannot be seen, due to the brightness of the lights.  You see people hiding
behind the curtains, making sure everything goes right.  The hall is silent,
waiting for a performance.
485.name: On Stage

description: This is a very cozy room.  A wide stone fireplace provides ample warmth.
A large soft bed sits near the fire, and a cushioned chair sits near the bed.
Books line the mantle, just waiting to be read.  Some pictures hang on the
wall.
464.name: Room 1

description: This is a very cozy room.  A wide stone fireplace provides ample warmth.
A large soft bed sits near the fire, and a cushioned chair sits near the bed.
Books line the mantle, just waiting to be read.  Some pictures hang on the
wall.
467.name: Room 4

description: This is a very cozy room.  A wide stone fireplace provides ample warmth.
A large soft bed sits near the fire, and a cushioned chair sits near the bed.
Books line the mantle, just waiting to be read.  Some pictures hang on the
wall.
465.name: Room 2

description: You stand in a cluttered office.  A desk sits in the middle of the room
with papers stacked to the ceiling.  Pictures hang on the walls showing past
great fighters that fought in the arena.  You see on the desk an empty flask
and a stain on some important looking papers.  The only exit is back west.
431.name: Manager's Office

description: You stand in the great lobby of the Parliment Of Westbridge.  You see the
walls and pillars of this hall seem to be made from diffrent color marble.
In the middle of the floor the symbol of the Tri-Power State shines brightly
from the sun coming in from the skylight above.  A door to the west leads to
the local healing shop, to the east, heavly guarded is the 1st National Bank
Of The Tri-Power State.
475.name: Lobby Of City Hall

description: The room is bare and all you see are the boards of the walls.  This room
is still under construction.
487.name: Deputy Mayor Morus's Office

description: You stand on a large bridge, that extends between two mountains.  The
moon shines above, giving only the outlines of jagged, pointed mountains,
and the bridge.  Below you see many torches and spikes, sharp and evil.
407.name: Pit

description: A large skull floats here in the air.  Then the large pike below it
catches your eyes.  The body is nowhere in sight.
446.name: Northwest Arena

description: You move slowly through the tunnel, tring not to disturb the soft
soil above. Sounds from cracks within the walls scratch at the
presence of your light.
404.name: River Tunnel

description: You stand in a large underground lobby. This is the lobby of the arena where
all pkillers come to battle against each other. The walls are carved out of
the stone that was below the Market Square. You see a Souvenir Shop to the
west and the Manager's Office to the east. The Arena is to the south.
430.name: Coliseum Of Pain

description: This is the middle section of the inn hallway.  There are pictures
occupying the spaces between each door.  There is a door to the west
and a door to the east.
{x
{G     <==<< {BRoom {R3 {*[{RThe Westbridge Inn{*] {BRoom {R4 {G>>==>{x
452.name: Hallway in the Inn

description: You are a loser, leave now.
448.name: Loser's Exit

description: You are at a bend in the hallway.  The hallway turns to the east and
south.  To the south a pair of large doors stand, with the words over it
"Court Room Of The TriPower".  Inside you hear someone talking, in defense
of someone elses actions, and the sound of a judge swinging a hammer.
478.name: Hallway

description: In the corner a fresh kill stands.  A sword holds the corpse up in the
corner.  Blood still is leaking out of the corpse.
444.name: NorthEast Arena

description: You stand in the hallway that goes to the stage.  If you are not an actor
or someone who is going to speak onstage, then you must go back.
482.name: Hallway behind the Opera

description: You are inside the colliseum toilet.  Its alot bigger than you though.
Inside here, its like a big underwater playground.  All you can see is clear
dark water, and a rock bottom.  On the bottom of the toilet you see a large
couch.  And hey, strangly you can breath here...
416.name: Inside The Toilet

description: You stand in the worst bathroom around.  The toilet, which should be
white, is an off-grayish brown color.  The walls are stained a dark color
and the smell is horrible.  The sink has been ripped out of the wall, the
mirror smashed.  The walls written on some things like 'For A Good Time Call
Gwar Women'.
433.name: Bathroom

description: You enter the Colliseum Of {RPain{7 Bar Room.  Before you a large bar
stands, with a man behind it, serving many drinks.  People sit around, and
watch the arena fight through the Viewing Crystals, which is a magical
device that allows this.  On the main floor, many round tables stand,
covering most of the floor.
414.name: Colliseum Bar

description: This is the end of the upstairs hallway.  There are doors to each
side and a large window that looks north over the Yawning Portal Bar
and the courtyard of temples.
{x
{G     <==<< {BRoom {R11 {*[{RThe Westbridge Inn{*] {BRoom {R12 {G>>==>{x
456.name: Upstairs Hallway Of The Inn

description: The dirt ground here is clean.  You see a few blackened shards of human
flesh on the ground, and a few bones.....
{x
{Y[ {RFREE PK ZONE SOUTH! {Y]{x
439.name: North Arena

description: This is a very cozy room.  A wide stone fireplace provides ample warmth.
A large soft bed sits near the fire, and a cushioned chair sits near the bed.
Books line the mantle, just waiting to be read.  Some pictures hang on the
wall.
466.name: Room 3

description: A rope with a bucket on it hangs partway down the inside of the well.
Further downward, blackness takes over.
425.name: Inside The Well

description: The room is bare and all you see are the boards of the walls.  This room
is still under construction.
493.name: Jury Member's Rooms

description: You enter the upper levels of the Colliseum Of Pain.  To the east and
west of you, row after row of stone carved seats look at the underground
colliseum.  To the south, a large building stands, almost hanging over the
colliseum.  To the north, a bar sits, waiting for you to drink.
410.name: The Seatings Of The Colliseum

description: A lovely spot here provides a breath of fresh air.  This small courtyard
borders the northern city wall and is filled with grass.  A large well is
in the middle of the yard.  There is an open way south to the inn dining
room.  A door to the west leads to a small smoking room where {RQuija, the{x
{RQuestmaster {xcan be found.
424.name: Outside The Inn

description: You are inside a river tunnel. You see it turns and heads on a
more eastern path. The tunnel is dark and dank from the years of
being cut away from rock. As you move through the tunnel sand
falls from above.
403.name: River Tunnel

description: You enter the Train Station of Westbridge.  Here, a very large and
very well built station stands.  The walls, ceiling and floor are made
from a fine white marble.  Its very bright in here.  You see people
walking all around, sitting and waiting for there train to come in.
To the east, you see a door leading out to the Platform.  To the east,
you see the ticket seller.  To the west, you see a door leading into
the "Yawning Portal Inn"
472.name: The Westbridge Train Station

description: More junk lies around in this place, tables and chairs line the wall, and
other things.  The hallway continues to go east and south.
484.name: Hallway

description: The hallway is long, and filled with props and other things used for the
Opera House.  People sit next to tables, looking into a mirror proped up on
them, and get ready for the next performance.
483.name: Hallway

description:
He is a jolly old fellow.  He has been here since the Inn was built.  He
once owned and ran the inn until he grew to old, and Durnan bought it from
him.  Out of the kindness of Durnan's Heart he now sells keys to the inn.  
{*{&Inn Keeper Hours {#6 {!am to {#10 {!pm{x
450.room_name: Vutale The Inn Keeper Stands here, selling rooms.
450.name: Vutale The Inn Keeper~

description: A very fat woman who looks to enjoy eating as much as she enjoys cooking.
407.room_name: The cook stands here making some stew.
407.name: the cook~

description: You gonna buya something or do I hafta breaka ya facea.
400.room_name: Tony is here making some pizza.
400.name: Tony~

401.room_name: The Colliseum Of Pain Bartender Stands here, watching you.
401.name: the bartender~

402.room_name: The Railway Ticket Seller stands here.
402.name: The Railway Ticket Seller~

description:
Justin is a tall skinny bartender.He has light brown hair
that looks awful.He is here cleaning some glasses so that
his bar can be the best in Westbridge.
405.room_name: Justin the bartender is here, serving minors.
405.name: Justin the bartender~

description: The Guest Turns And Says "I'm eating, please leave me along"
406.room_name: A Inn Guest sits here enjoying there food.
406.name: a inn guest~

description: Type 'heal' to see a listing of spells.
471.room_name: The healer sits here casting spells and telling stories.
471.name: the healer~

description: He is the wise man in the land.
472.room_name: Quija the great Questmaster sits here in all his wisdom.

description: He is a hard worker.
409.room_name: A working class citizen sits at the bar drinking his cares away.
409.name: a working class citizen~

description: Kill Them.
410.room_name: An adventurer sits here, chatting about the latest rumors.
410.name: an adventurer~

description:
Otho is grotesquely fat man dressed in rich clothes.  Apparently the banking
business pays quite well in this busy city, or possibly the rumors
of his fencing services are true...
475.room_name: Otho the Banker sits behind his desk, waiting for your coins.
475.name: Otho the Banker~
475.keywords: otho money changer moneychanger bank banker~

description: He is dressed in "The Legion" uniform. He is about the age of 20, working.
476.room_name: An Officer Of The Citizens Relations sits behind the desk.
476.name: Citizens Relation Officer~

F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
476.t_flags: T Welcome To The TriPower's Local Citizen's Relations Office, in Westbridge.~

description: He looks like he's on steriods, i wouldn't mess with him.
474.room_name: The City Hall Jail Guard stands here, watching everyone.
474.name: The City Hall Jail Guard~

description: A Waitress stands here server the guests.
408.room_name: A Inn waitress is here to serve you.
408.name: a inn waitress~

description: Type 'heal' to see a listing of spells.
411.room_name: The healer sits here casting spells and telling stories.
411.name: the healer~

description: BUY SOMETHING!!
430.room_name: The Souvenir shopkeeper stands here, selling shit.
430.name: The Souvenir Owner~

description: HIT ME!! HIT ME HARDER!! HIT ME NOW!!
431.name: The Dummy~

description: BUY SOMETHING!!
432.room_name: The Peanut and Popcorn Guy is here, selling peanuts and popcorn.
432.name: The Peanut and Popcorn Guy~

description:
Otis is a very large fellow indeed.  He wears a black wife-beater shit, a
pair of black cloth pants and is overlooking everyone in the gym.  He is a
burry guy with a beard, and a hairy chest.
438.room_name: Otis the trainer stands here with a clipboard and a whip.
438.name: Otis The Trainer~

description: Quija's servant says '{!please free me{x'
473.room_name: Quija's Servant is here selling drinks and food.
473.name: Quija's Servant~
